ClinicalDocument.title: Department of Veterans Affairs Summarization of Episode Note

tr.th: Business Rules for Construction of Medical Information

tr.td: This section contains all patient allergy information from all VA treatment facilities. It does not contain patient allergies that were deleted or entered in error.

td.content: Propensity to adverse reactions to food

code.displayName: Propensity to adverse reactions to food

tr.th: Business Rules for Construction of Medical Information

tr.td: This section contains patient conditions (active and inactive) information from all VA treatment facilities. It does not contain patient conditions that were deleted.

td.content: Plan of care consistent with patient level of function and ability during perioperative period (ICD-9-CM 799.9)
Sleep-wake schedule disorder, advanced phase type (ICD-9-CM 780.55)
Hemolytic disease of fetus OR newborn due to ABO immunization (ICD-9-CM 773.1)

tr.th: Business Rules for Construction of Medical Information

tr.td: This section contains patient medications (outpatient and self-reported) information from all VA treatment facilities for which the dispense date was within the last 15 months. Only medications that have an active or non-active prescription status are listed.

td.content: TAKE 2 TEASPOONFULS BY MOUTH FOUR TIMES A DAY AS NEEDED FOR COUGH
TAKE BY MOUTH TWO TIMES A WEEK

tr.th: Business Rules for Construction of Medical Information

tr.td: This section contains information from the ten most recent patient vital signs (inpatient and outpatient) from all VA treatment facilities for which the panel date taken was within the last 12 months. Note: If more than one panel was taken on the same date, only the most recent panel is populated for that date.

text.content: Vital Sign Observation Text Not Available

code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

tr.th: Business Rules for Construction of Medical Information

tr.td: This section contains patient immunizations information from all VA treatment facilities. Only administred (i.e., not refused) immunizations are included.

tr.th: Business Rules for Construction of Encounter Information

tr.td: This section contains information for the 25 most recent historical outpatient encounters (completed) for the patient from all VA treatment facilities for which the encounter date was within the last 36 months. Note: Ancillary visits are not included. Lists of associated note titles for each encounter are limited to a maximum of 10.

td.content: PRIMARY CARE/MEDICINE with associated notes CARDIOLOGY PROGRESS NOTE,CARDIOLOGY PROGRESS NOTE,CARDIOLOGY PROGRESS NOTE,CARDIOLOGY PROGRESS NOTE
